name: MISS MOUSE - Marilyn Monroe Rare Novelty Print Skirt
description:
This rare treasure is from the legendary British Boutique label Miss Mouse. Founded in 1970 by a 23-year-old Rae Spencer-Cullen, Miss Mouse was considered to be in the forefront of the 'avant garde' London fashion scene alongside Vivienne Westwood. Spencer-Cullen was declared by Harper's Bazaar one of the "leading style innovators" of her day and was inspired by 50's kitsch. This particular piece features illustrations of famous Marilyn Monroe photographs, and was shown at the recent Pop! Exhibition at the Fashion and Textile Museum.

Measurements:

Waist - 27"
Length - 32"

Condition:  Very good vintage condition.  There is very minor general fading from being washed.  The black is also slightly running in one small area on the back.  Both flaws are very insignificant.  Please feel free to message me for more pictures.

name: SUZY PERETTE - 60's Mod Red, White and Bow Dress
description:
The Suzy Perette company first opened in New York, 1949. It was the sister label to Gigi Young, and designed to imitate Parisian fashion. The shop was located at 134 W. 37th Street. This particular piece is lined, with a zipper up the back. It is in the classic mod colours and style, with a large pussy bow. It has been professionally dry-cleaned for your convenience.


Measurements:

Bust - 37"

Waist - 28"

Length - 40"

Shoulders - 15.5"



Condition:  This dress is in very good vintage condition.  There is a tiny black mark on the collar that is not visible when the collar is properly done up in the back.  There is also very slight yellowing near the bottom of the dress.  I only noticed this once I had the dress under my bright studio lights.

name: CATHERINE BUCKLEY - 70's Antique Lace Tiered Dress
description:
This is a very rare unlabeled dress by the British designer Catherine Buckley.  When I first found this dress in an antique store, I was baffled.  It is clearly 70's in design but the fabric appeared to be much older.  It was so stunning that I couldn't leave it behind.  I held onto it for quite some time before I found out about Catherine Buckley.  Catherine Buckley used jacquard fabrics dating from 1905-1935 in her designs.  When I saw a Buckley piece online, I noticed that it used the same piece of lace. On closer inspection, even the lining and zipper appear to be the same.  Due to how fragile her designs were, this is a truly rare find



This dress is very petite.  I was not able to do up the back on the mannequin.  The straps are meant to go just below the bust.  

Under-bust: 26"(max)
Waist: 24"
Length: 55"



Condition:  In the last picture you can view a couple of light marks on the dress.  Due to the colours, texture and structure you have to really look to find the flaws.  The most noteworthy is small brown mark near the waistband that measures .5 x .5 cm.  This in no way distracts from the beauty of the dress.



This dress has been professionally dry cleaned.



Please feel free to message me for more pictures or inquiries.

name: RADLEY - Ossie Clark Design - Red Moss Crepe Mini Dress
description:
This dress was manufactured by the English fashion house Radley.  Radley was best known for being associated with the iconic designer Ossie Clark.  Although this piece isn't a labelled Ossie, it is one of his well known designs.  Radley's in-house designer would often take Ossie's sketches and reproduce the garment.  It is even made out of his signature fabric, moss crepe.  


Measurements:

Bust - 34"
Waist - 29"
Hips - 34"
Shoulders - 15"

name: 20's Cherry Applique Black Sequin Cloche
description:
The more you look at this cloche the more incredible it becomes.  There are so many small details that go unnoticed at a first glance.  The entire hat is covered in sequins.  There are certain areas where the sequins are heavier, forming flowers with clumps of beads in the middle.  This is the quintessential flapper accessory.   




Condition:  This cloche is in excellent condition for it's age.  The only section that appears to be missing sequins is a small area next to the applique.  It can be easily viewed in the last picture.

name: YVES SAINT LAURENT - Russian Collection Paisley Blouse
description:
This blouse is part of the 1976 Russian collection of YSL's famous Rive Gauche label. The Russian Collection was thought to have influenced fashion globally, and Yves Saint-Laurent himself considered it to be his most beautiful collection to date. This blouse is made from very fine wool, and is in superb condition. The full, dramatic balloon sleeves contrast sharply with the sleek, slim cut of the torso, giving an air of elegance and style.   It has been professionally dry-cleaned for your convenience.

name: JEFF BANKS - Quilted Striped Jacket with Plaid Lining
description:
I'm very excited about this piece, because not only is Jeff Banks one of my all-time favourite British Boutique designers, but this is one of his most rare designs! A little background information on Jeff Banks: he first opened his boutique Clobber in 1964, stocking other designers (such as Ossie Clark and Jean Muir). The Beatles and Jean Shrimpton attended the opening, and everything (except one jacket) sold out that night! His success prompted Jeff Banks to start a Clobber line, and in 1969, he launched his eponymous label. This particular piece dates from the early 1970's, featuring structured avant-garde voluminous sleeves and blue plaid lining.

Measurements:

Bust: 32"
Waist: 32"
Length: 18"
Shoulders: 14"


Condition:  Excellent

name: CHELSEA COBBLER - Gold Star and Velvet Glam Boots
description:
Very rare boots from London's iconic shoe maker Chelsea Cobbler.  Chelsea Cobbler was a favourite of Bianca Jagger and many other royalties of British rock n' roll.  


Width: 3 6/16"
Heel: 3.5"

Size Stated: 6 UK, 8 US



Condition:  Overall these boots are in good condition, although they do show some signs of wear.  It appears that shoe glue was spilled in a small area on the outside of the right boot.  This has caused the velvet to slightly crack.  Shoe glue is also visible in a few areas around the rim of the sole.  These are all visible in the pictures.  There is very minimal wear to the soles and the velvet is lightly worn on the backs of the heels.  The boots have been priced accordingly.  Feel free to ask for more pictures!

name: FRED SLATTEN - Rare Leather Heels by Iconic Designer
description:
Fred Slatten is best known for the outrageous platforms sold in his Santa Monica shop in the 1970's.  He was a favourite of Elton John, Bianca Jagger, Nancy Sinatra, Cher, Marvin Gaye and many other fashionable people of the era.  These are a pair of rare early Fred Slatten shoes.  



Measurements -


Length: 9.5"

Width: 2 7/8"

Heel: 2.75"

Size Stated: 6.5 AA



Condition:  These shoes are in very good condition.  There is light wear to the soles and a couple of light scratches on the heels.  The leather is in near mint condition
